alert.note: Alert for Central Siskiyou County; Western Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued September 02 at 4:34PM PDT until September 02 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PDT THIS EVENING... The Flash Flood Watch is now in effect for * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall are possible over the McKinney and Head burn scars. * WHEN...Through this 9 PM PDT this evening. * IMPACTS...There is potential for heavy rainfall over the McKinney and Head burn scars during the period of the watch. People traveling on Highway 96, living along Klamath River Road or recreating in the Humbug area should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Central Siskiyou County; Western Siskiyou County
